definitions: the killing or destruction of a large proportion of a group or species

examples.text: our growing hunger for fish has resulted in the decimation of fish stocks

shortDefinitions: killing or destruction of large proportion of group

definitions: a drastic reduction in the strength or effectiveness of something

examples.text: we need to halt the decimation of this country's manufacturing base
economic and financial decimation from two world wars

shortDefinitions: drastic reduction in strength or effectiveness of something

definitions: the killing of one in every ten of a group of people as a punishment for the whole group (originally with reference to a mutinous Roman legion).
shortDefinitions: killing of one in every ten of group as punishment for whole group
